text: - My name is Alex Anglin.

I'm a senior data architect
with AWS Professional Services,
supporting our public sector customers.
I solve problems with data.

Our customers have lots of
data and lots of challenges.

They need to make complex
and strategic decisions,

and my team builds data
and analytical systems
to help them meet those goals.

There's a lot about how
AWS operates as a whole
which enables it for success.

Things like understanding
data-driven decision-making

is something that is embedded
really across the company
and is expected of everyone in their role.

This and other things
are things that I felt

would benefit my career
and allow me to succeed
on the path that I'm on now.
As a father of a toddler,

I'm a member of the
families affinity group
and I've been able to avail myself
the many resources offered through that.
Mental health is also a topic
that is very near and dear to my heart,

especially as a knowledge
worker in today's economy.

I'm also a member of the
AWS Male Allies program,

where we look to address
challenges of gender diversity
in the industry.
It's important for a company like AWS
to have all these affinity groups,

because we only succeed when
we recognize individuals

for their unique talents and
what they bring to the table.
